resources.string: 1) A logistics network can best be described as:
The choice of rail, marine, or truck transport
The warehouses, production facilities, \n retailers, and inventory that flows between them
3) Why are LCL lead times longer than FCL lead times?
Shipments may move on different vessels
Consolidation and deconsolidation procedures at origin and destination ports take longer

4)This term means that the seller delivers the goods, \n cleared for export, to the carrier nominated by the buyer at the named place. Seller pays for carriage to the named place. Which incoterm is this? (Only Abbreviation)
5) The use of two or more different modes of transport in moving goods \n from origin to destination is known as:
